column4: hi, is it possible to create nested group under traditional Linux group access method? e.g. in /etc/group can i create a group inside another group?
groups can be members of other groups i believe
how do i put it in /etc/group file?

not really a great idea to be directly editing that file if you don't know what you're doing.  there are commands for adding users/groups to the system (sorry off the top of my head can't remember them)
